subject: AI & Agents
title: When AI Is the Wrong Solution
description: A short lesson to help you apply When AI Is the Wrong Solution.

hook.text: Your team spent 6 months building an ML model. A simple SQL query did the same thing.

buildup.text: AI adds complexity: training data, model maintenance, unpredictable outputs, and latency.

discovery.text: Rules, heuristics, and simple statistics solve many problems faster and more reliably.

twist.text: AI is expensive to maintain. If the problem doesn't change, rules don't need retraining.

climax.text: Use AI when: patterns are complex, data is abundant, and perfect rules are impossible.

punchline.text: The best AI decision is sometimes not to use AI.

quiz.question: When should you avoid using AI?
options: When simple rules or SQL can solve the problem
When you have too much data
